titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَزْدَرِدُ نُخَامَتَهُ وَ يَدْخُلُ حَلْقَهُ الذُّبَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 35 – Regarding the Fasting-one who swallows his mucus and the fly enters into his throat

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُصُّ الْخَاتَمَ وَ الْحَصَاةَ وَ النَّوَاةَ
titles.en: Chapter 36 – Regarding the man who sucks the ring, and the pebble, and the date stone

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَذُوقُ الْقِدْرَ وَ يَزُقُّ الْفَرْخَ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – Regarding the Fasting one who tastes (from) the cooking pot, and tastes (for) the chicks (young children)

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَزْدَرِدُ نُخَامَتَهُ وَ يَدْخُلُ حَلْقَهُ الذُّبَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 35 – Regarding the Fasting-one who swallows his mucus and the fly enters into his throat

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/299)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَزْدَرِدَ الصَّائِمُ نُخَامَتَهُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Giyas Bin Ibrahim,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem with the Fasting one swallowing his own mucus’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘ Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not harmful if a fasting person swallows his mucus.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/299)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ مَسْعَدَةَ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ( عليهم السلام ) أَنَّ عَلِيّاً صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ سُئِلَ عَنِ الذُّبَابِ يَدْخُلُ حَلْقَ الصَّائِمِ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ قَضَاءٌ لِأَنَّهُ لَيْسَ بِطَعَامٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Haroun Bin Muslim, from Mas’ada Bin Sadaqa,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, from his<sup>asws</sup> forefathers<sup>asws</sup> that Ali<sup>asws</sup> was asked about the fly entering throat of the Fasting one. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no making up for it upon him, because it is not food’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Harun ibn Muslim Mas’adah ibn Sadaqah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has narrated from his ancestors who have said that Ali, ‘Alayhi al- Salam, upon being asked about a fly entering the throat of a fasting person, said, ‘There is no Qada’ (compensatory fast) on him because it is not food.’”
